6C935482574C44D698B03E911AE7FBA4.description: Differentiate when situation calls for speaking in complete sentences

80FF61422DFA413FB3DD4478BE352814.description:
Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to
provide requested detail or clarification (see grade 3 Language standards 1 and 3 for
specific expectations).

96DA4C03F2FA460D894EB2209423236E.description: Read stories or poems fluently for audio recordings

C219DA9822E8431C8A5FCA03D594A220.description:
Determine when visual displays will emphasize and enhance understanding of
presentations

586BE055FA85405594B106682E37183E.description:
Create engaging audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid
reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to emphasize
or enhance certain understanding of presentations.

C51713E458FD4E71B64D120A6B2B7DBE.description: Speak clearly at an appropriate pace

E3609FB60C654668B4B4F9C5BBB13F55.description: Determine facts and relevant descriptive details

F0122E3968404FC9A2237364AF0B93FC.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate
facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

FE08DF2C0CA4472099D06AE8E0E514D5.description:
Formulate answers about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration
and detail

4799E757C940460C8C12150CC84238CE.description: Formulate appropriate questions about information from a speaker

Identify appropriate elaboration and detail when answering questions about information

CDFFE426C6CA4753928A1365E5E39F2B.description:
Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate
elaboration and detail.

8DBB1169667543388B49BF4380885B5D.description: Determine the main idea and supporting details of an oral or media presentation

A1021521E2474E73AE3AD4BB6E5886F7.description:
Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or
information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

B80FCB000C5C4020A2090AFE1FB53160.description: Explain the topic using personal ideas, opinions, and reasoning after discussion

0FDC77B00A9A4A068CF1EC41D9E5B365.description: Identify key ideas presented during discussion

4B4B5A16883749E388C20B583389B81E.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

6FF30EE95FD74ACAB55AA6B5869573D5.description:
Formulate questions and responses based on comments made by others during
discussion

1125BA282EE3471EB20C8ED39AB0F810.description:
Ask questions to check understanding of information presented presented, stay
on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.

AC4AAF39E26F4DCAB1B58597F010E321.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g.,gaining the floor in respectful
ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and
texts under discussion).

44DA93EB3CB244D0983050FBE2C1EDCB.description: Identify key ideas from reading material

33352E5DEAA04F2FA37D282AEBAD6E04.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one -on-one, in groups,
and teacher - led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others'
ideas and expressing their own clearly.

5EBE51603A2B4ADCAD8DF260592BB3F6.description: Identify words that signal spatial and temporal relationships

450A28AA22764B49BE6DC6DF5EAA75C8.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic,

relationships (e.g., After dinner that night we went looking for them).

3C659037D1EB4E24A4DD57AEA50AB116.description: Identify the meanings of related words

165AAEE1203D42D4825740F1330D3215.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind
or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

6D6C10D4EFBE47E1AE027EBC481C1CF2.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people
who are friendly or helpful.)

C0A5BCA57BDD4DDFA8B1F770FD842224.description:
Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context
(e.g., take steps).

64C37900AA634A58AF38D6A46A019122.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships and nuances
in word meanings.

A807159A82CC411E857CB92925F4B17B.description:
Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or
clarifyy the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

61EC52F057AE4428A2933324EA7968E2.description:
Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the
same root (e.g., company, companion).

04A7104AD6B346A9942A2401995D6699.description: Explain the meaning of known affixes

5A9F03FFF5124FA1810DE2FF3ACFCE19.description:

ABB59914D6E94F1DB0914A7A9CE82C79.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

2E69162E40214A6385E868CDD20AAA4A.description:

604B4DE797ED4640BCD8CDAC94761CAB.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.

7C5FABAC139E466E88BA523626539CB7.description:

Demonstrate command of standard English grammar and usage when writing or

C3F46BCC0BCD46669ABA571819C56D86.description: Participate in short research projects to gain knowledge

AE57ED9054F24F92B890AA08FA817ADE.description: Distinguish between relevant and irrelevant information

EC9B596E30EB4948952FB784D2524DF7.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.
